description:
A modern file manager for Windows 10 and Windows 11.

OneCommander is a modern file manager for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Features include tabs, dual-pane browsers, columns navigation, built-in preview, a theming system, color tags, and much more. It is free for home use and has no ads.
ğŸ› ï¸ Fixes issue with SVG thumbnail handler (regression due to workaround for PowerToys SVG preview issue). I suggest using resvg instead. This update will try to detect it and purge OC's SVG cache. It can be controlled with the option in Settings-Advanced (bottom)
ğŸ› ï¸ Taskmaster 0.9, option to set all file dates to original dates (set as default)
ğŸ› ï¸ Rename not showing extension change dialog unless extension was completely removed. Dialog for this was also redesigned.
ğŸ› ï¸ .ico files show the highest resolution icon. This update purges the .ico thumbnail cache so this can be seen
ğŸ› ï¸ If Google Drive bugs-out and starts affecting OC performance, popup is shown offering to restart Google Drive
ğŸ› ï¸ New window is created in size and position of the previous window (+offset)
ğŸ› ï¸ Folder icons pngs applied to original name in addition to localized name
ğŸ Fixed jumplist (taskbar right-click menu) listing available windows
ğŸ Fixed splashscreen logo black background
ğŸ Fixed disabling option to Ctrl+V to paste as text; paste filename format is in 24h format
ğŸ Fixed RMB opening shortcut location if opencontaining is removed from Excluded menu list
ğŸ Fixed setting work directory for context menu items (affecting only a few)
ğŸ› ï¸ New user defaults changed - Rename through Explorer dialogs is enabled, and showing file extensions
